intro: Aneilema filipes, commonly known as the slender-leaved aneilema, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically with white or pale yellow petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
